trans-unit.source: Devices, sensors, and power
trans-unit.target: Devices, sensors, and power

trans-unit.source: In order to provide a rich experience for your users, you may find it necessary to integrate external devices or sensors into your app.
trans-unit.target: In order to provide a rich experience for your users, you may find it necessary to integrate external devices or sensors into your app.

trans-unit.source: Devices, sensors, and power
trans-unit.target: Devices, sensors, and power

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: In order to provide a rich experience for your users, you may find it necessary to integrate external devices or sensors into your app.
trans-unit.target: In order to provide a rich experience for your users, you may find it necessary to integrate external devices or sensors into your app.

trans-unit.source: Here are some examples of features that you can add to your app using the technology described in this section.
trans-unit.target: Here are some examples of features that you can add to your app using the technology described in this section.

trans-unit.source: Providing an enhanced print experience
trans-unit.target: Providing an enhanced print experience

trans-unit.source: Integrating motion and orientation sensors into your game
trans-unit.target: Integrating motion and orientation sensors into your game

trans-unit.source: Connecting to a device directly or through a network protocol
trans-unit.target: Connecting to a device directly or through a network protocol

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Enable device capabilities
trans-unit.target: Enable device capabilities

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes how to declare device capabilities in Microsoft Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes how to declare device capabilities in Microsoft Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: This enables your app to use cameras, microphones, location sensors, and other devices.
trans-unit.target: This enables your app to use cameras, microphones, location sensors, and other devices.

trans-unit.source: Enumerate devices
trans-unit.target: Enumerate devices

trans-unit.source: The enumeration namespace enables you to find devices that are internally connected to the system, externally connected, or detectable over wireless or networking protocols.
trans-unit.target: The enumeration namespace enables you to find devices that are internally connected to the system, externally connected, or detectable over wireless or networking protocols.

trans-unit.source: Pair devices
trans-unit.target: Pair devices

trans-unit.source: Some devices need to be paired before they can be used.
trans-unit.target: Some devices need to be paired before they can be used.

trans-unit.source: The [Windows.Devices.Enumeration](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225459) namespace supports three different ways to pair devices.
trans-unit.target: The [Windows.Devices.Enumeration](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225459) namespace supports three different ways to pair devices.

trans-unit.source: Sensors
trans-unit.target: Sensors

trans-unit.source: Sensors let your app know the relationship between a device and the physical world around it.
trans-unit.target: Sensors let your app know the relationship between a device and the physical world around it.

trans-unit.source: Sensors can tell your app the direction, orientation, and movement of the device.
trans-unit.target: Sensors can tell your app the direction, orientation, and movement of the device.

trans-unit.source: Bluetooth
trans-unit.target: Bluetooth

trans-unit.source: This section contains articles on how to integrate Bluetooth into Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, including how to use RFCOMM, GATT, and Low Energy (LE) Advertisements.
trans-unit.target: This section contains articles on how to integrate Bluetooth into Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, including how to use RFCOMM, GATT, and Low Energy (LE) Advertisements.

trans-unit.source: Printing and scanning
trans-unit.target: Printing and scanning

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to print and scan from your Universal Windows app.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to print and scan from your Universal Windows app.

trans-unit.source: Create an NFC Smart Card app
trans-unit.target: Create an NFC Smart Card app

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8.1 supported NFC card emulation apps using a SIM-based secure element, but that model required secure payment apps to be tightly coupled with mobile-network operators (MNO).
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8.1 supported NFC card emulation apps using a SIM-based secure element, but that model required secure payment apps to be tightly coupled with mobile-network operators (MNO).

trans-unit.source: This limited the variety of possible payment solutions by other merchants or developers that are not coupled with MNOs.
trans-unit.target: This limited the variety of possible payment solutions by other merchants or developers that are not coupled with MNOs.

trans-unit.source: In Windows 10 Mobile, we have introduced a new card emulation technology called, Host Card Emulation (HCE).
trans-unit.target: In Windows 10 Mobile, we have introduced a new card emulation technology called, Host Card Emulation (HCE).

trans-unit.source: HCE technology allows your app to directly communicate with an NFC card reader.
trans-unit.target: HCE technology allows your app to directly communicate with an NFC card reader.

trans-unit.source: This topic illustrates how Host Card Emulation (HCE) works on Windows 10 Mobile devices and how you can develop an HCE app so that your customers can access your services through their phone instead of a physical card without collaborating with an MNO.
trans-unit.target: This topic illustrates how Host Card Emulation (HCE) works on Windows 10 Mobile devices and how you can develop an HCE app so that your customers can access your services through their phone instead of a physical card without collaborating with an MNO.

trans-unit.source: Get battery information
trans-unit.target: Get battery information

trans-unit.source: Learn how to get detailed battery information using APIs in the [Windows.Devices.Power](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895017) namespace.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to get detailed battery information using APIs in the [Windows.Devices.Power](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895017) namespace.
